title: Career Opportunities
subtitle: Careers at Luk & Associates
tagline:
Build your legal career with a team that moves fast—and teaches you well.
Luk & Associates is a growing, multi-practice law firm in Markham, Ontario. We serve clients across family law, real estate, wills and estates, small claims/LTB, and immigration.
If you’re sharp, reliable, and want meaningful responsibility, you’ll fit in here.
howToApplyDescription: Email your application to info@luklaw.ca with the subject line: “Role – Your Name” Or apply through the form below.
whatToExpectSteps:
• High standards, strong support. We train you, but we expect ownership and accuracy.
  • Real client exposure. You’ll learn practical legal workflows and professional judgment.
  • Clear growth path. Intern → assistant/clerk → senior support → paralegal track (where applicable).
  • A modern team. Systems, templates, checklists, and a culture of improving how we work.
  • Bilingual environment. Many of our clients communicate in Chinese.
languagesRequiredDescription: Because a significant portion of our clients communicate in Chinese, fluency in English and either Mandarin or Cantonese is required for all roles.

faqs.question: Do you require bilingual ability for every role?
faqs.answer: Yes. Fluency in English and either Mandarin or Cantonese (spoken and written) is required for all roles due to client needs.

faqs.question: Is the work remote/hybrid?
faqs.answer: Most roles are primarily in-office in Markham due to training, teamwork, and file handling.

faqs.question: Do you train?
faqs.answer: Yes—especially for interns and junior roles. We provide guidance and systems, but we expect you to be coachable and precise.

faqs.question: What makes someone successful here?
faqs.answer: Reliability, attention to detail, clean communication, and the ability to execute without constant supervision.

accessibilityStatement: We are committed to a respectful and inclusive workplace. Accommodations are available upon request throughout the hiring process in accordance with applicable Ontario legislation.
privacyNotice: Information submitted through applications is used only for recruitment and hiring purposes.

roles.title: Legal Intern
roles.bestFor: Undergraduate students or pre-law candidates exploring a legal career.
responsibilities: File organization and client intake support
Drafting simple correspondence and organizing supporting documents
Guided legal research tasks
Assisting with admin workflows and internal checklists
Other duties assigned
fitIf: Able to work in-office in Markham
roles.requirements: Required: Fluent English and Fluent Mandarin or Cantonese
success90Days: Can follow firm systems without reminders

roles.title: Legal Assistant
roles.bestFor: Organized, client-friendly people who can handle volume without dropping details.
responsibilities: Client communication, intake coordination, and scheduling
File maintenance and document management
Drafting routine correspondence and forms using templates
Supporting lawyers and paralegals with deadline tracking and follow-ups
Keeping files moving efficiently and accurately
fitIf: Calm under pressure and fast with details
Strong with Word and PDF tools and file organization
Confident on the phone and in professional email communication
Able to manage multiple files at once
roles.requirements: Required: Fluent English and Fluent Mandarin or Cantonese
success90Days: Catches issues before they become problems
Reliably moves files forward every day

roles.title: Law Clerk
roles.bestFor: Candidates who enjoy process, documents, and getting things clean and correct.
responsibilities: Drafting and preparing documents using firm precedents
Managing correspondence, file materials, and client updates
Supporting workflows across practice areas as needed
Maintaining accurate file notes and timelines
Coordinating with clients and third parties
fitIf: Meticulous, consistent, and comfortable with process-heavy work
Strong at proofreading and spotting inconsistencies
Able to learn new practice areas quickly
Confident communicating with clients and third parties
roles.requirements: Required: Fluent English and Fluent Mandarin or Cantonese
success90Days: Drafting is accurate and formatted properly
Files are organized, trackable, and deadline-safe
The team can trust the work product

roles.title: Licensed Paralegal
roles.bestFor: Independent operators who can manage files, clients, and timelines with minimal handholding.
responsibilities: Managing Small Claims and LTB matters (and other areas as applicable)
Client intake, strategy support, and file progression
Drafting, filing, and attending hearings where applicable
Negotiation support and settlement-driven file management
Maintaining organized notes, deadlines, and case plans
fitIf: Professional and confident with client communication
Extremely detail-driven with deadlines and evidence organization
Able to move files proactively without waiting to be told
roles.requirements: Required: Fluent English and Fluent Mandarin or Cantonese
success90Days: Runs files with clear plans and consistent client updates
Matters are organized, deadline-safe, and moving forward
Improves systems, not just follows them

howToApply.title: How to Apply
howToApply.intro: Please include the following when submitting your application.

steps.title: Resume (PDF)
steps.description: Attach a clean, updated resume in PDF format.

steps.title: Short cover note (5–10 sentences)
steps.description: Clearly answer the prompts below so we understand your fit and goals.
prompts: What are you working toward in the next 1–2 years?

steps.title: Language confirmation
steps.description: Confirm whether you are fluent in Mandarin or Cantonese, and your comfort level with spoken and written communication.

steps.title: Optional but helpful
steps.description: These items are not required, but can help us better understand your background.
items: Earliest start date and weekly availability
